summary: This bill, the Transparency in CFPB Cost-Benefit Analysis Act, aims to enhance the rulemaking requirements for the Bureau of Consumer Financial Protection (CFPB). It mandates the CFPB to provide extensive analysis in its proposed regulations, including the need for the regulation, alternatives, cost-benefit assessments (including impacts on small businesses), and justifications if costs outweigh benefits. The bill also requires the CFPB to disclose underlying assumptions and studies used in its analysis.
